name: ntedit
description: Fast, lightweight, scalable genome sequence polishing and SNV detection & annotation

options.description: number of threads [default=1]
draft genome assembly (FASTA, Multi-FASTA, and/or gzipped compatible), REQUIRED
Bloom filter file (generated from ntHits), REQUIRED
secondary Bloom filter with k-mers to reject (generated from ntHits), OPTIONAL
output file prefix, OPTIONAL
minimum contig length [default=100]
maximum number of insertion bases to try, range 0-5, [default=5]
maximum number of deletions bases to try, range 0-10, [default=5]
k/x ratio for the number of k-mers that should be missing, [default=5.000]
k/y ratio for the number of edited k-mers that should be present, [default=9.000]
ratio of number of k-mers in the k subset that should be missing in order to attempt fix (higher=stringent), [default=0.5]
ratio of number of k-mers in the k subset that should be present to accept an edit (higher=stringent), [default=0.5]
cap for the number of base insertions that can be made at one position, [default=k*1.5]
controls size of k-mer subset. When checking subset of k-mers, check every jth k-mer, [default=3]
mode of editing, range 0-2, [default=0] 0: best substitution, or first good indel 1: best substitution, or best indel 2: best edit overall (suggestion that you reduce i and d for performance)
SNV mode. Overrides draft k-mer checks, forcing reassessment at each position (-s 1 = yes, default = 0, no)
input VCF file with annotated variants (e.g., clinvar.vcf), OPTIONAL
soft masks missing k-mer positions having no fix (-v 1 = yes, default = 0, no)
verbose mode (-v 1 = yes, default = 0, no)
display this message and exit
output version information and exit
